member.name: T:DotSpatial.Symbology.BackBuffer
member.summary: This class contains two separate layers. The first is the BackImage where features that don't change over time are drawn. This way if heavy calculations are required to draw the background, you don't have to re-draw the background over and over again every time a sprite moves. The Front image is for small sprites that change rapidly, but

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Symbology.Descriptor
member.summary: Descriptors are simple classes that are used for storing symbology or other basic characteristics. They are presumed to be made up of value types and other descriptors, and are expected to be serializable. This being said, some basic capabilities are supported for randomizing, copying and comparing the properties of descriptors.

member.summary: CopyBase

member.summary: Creates a new instance of CopyBase

member.summary: Creates a duplicate of this descriptor using MemberwiseClone

member.summary: PropertyInfo returns overridden members as separate entries. We would rather work with each members only one time.
member.param: All the properties, including duplicates created by overridden members
member.returns: An Array of PropertyInfo members

member.summary: This occurs during the Copy method and is overridable by sub-classes

member.summary: IDescriptor

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Symbology.IMatchable
member.summary: Matching is defined as being a different object, but having properties that would make it indistinguishable from the comparision property. This is an alternative to overriding the equals behavior in cases where you might ALSO need to see if the object reference is the same.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.IMatchable.Matches(DotSpatial.Symbology.IMatchable,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String}@)
member.summary: Tests this object against the comparison object. If any of the value type members are different, or if any of the properties are IMatchable and do not match, then this returns false.
member.param: The other IMatcheable object of the same type
The list of property names that do not match
member.returns: Boolean, true if the properties are comparably equal.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Symbology.IRandomizable
member.summary: IRandomizable

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.IRandomizable.Randomize(System.Random)
member.summary: This method will set the values for this class with random values that are within acceptable parameters for this class.
member.param: An existing random number generator so that the random seed can be controlled

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.IDescriptor.CopyProperties(System.Object)
member.summary: This copies the public descriptor properties from the specified object to this object.
member.param: An object that has properties that match the public properties on this object.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Descriptor.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of MatchableObject

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Descriptor.CopyProperties(System.Object)
member.summary: For each of the publicly accessible properties found on this object, this attempts to copy a public property from the source object of the same name, if it can find it. For each matching property name/type, it will attempt to copy the value.
member.param: The

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Descriptor.Matches(DotSpatial.Symbology.IMatchable,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String}@)
member.summary: Compares the properties of this object with the specified IMatchable other. This does not test every property of other, but does test every property of this item. As long as the other item has corresponding properties for every property on this item, the items are said to match. The IMatchable interface allows custom definitions of matching. For collections to match, all of their sub-members must match.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Descriptor.Randomize(System.Random)
member.summary: The default behavior is to cycle through all the properties of this object, and call Randomize on any that implement the IRandomizable interface.
member.param: The Random seed generator for controling how the random content is created

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Descriptor.OnCopyProperties(System.Object)
member.summary: This occurs while copying properties from the specified source, and is the default handling for subclasses

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Descriptor.OnMatch(DotSpatial.Symbology.IMatchable,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: This gives sub-classes the chance to directly override, control or otherwise tamper with the matching process. This is also where normal matching is performed, so to replace it, simply don't call the base.OnMatch method. To tweak the results, the base method should be performed first, and the results can then be modified.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Descriptor.OnRandomize(System.Random)
member.summary: This allows overrideable behavior that can replace or extend the basic behavior, which is to call Randomize on any public properties that are listed as randomizeable. This does nothing to normal properties or non public members and needs to be overriden to provide the special case functionality for sub-classes.
member.param: The random number generator to be used during randomization

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Symbology.Changeable
member.summary: ChangeBase

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Changeable.ForceChange
member.summary: Forces the Changed event to fire. If events are suspended, then this simply will mark the changes so that when the ResumeChanges is called it will automatically fire the Changed events.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Changeable.ResumeChanges
member.summary: Resumes the events. If any changes occured during the period of time when the events were suspended, this will automatically fire the chnaged event.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Changeable.SuspendChanges
member.summary: Causes this filter collection to suspend the Changed event, so that it will only be fired once after a series of updates.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Changeable.OnChanged
member.summary: Fires the Changed event as long as ChangesSuspended is not true.

member.name: E:DotSpatial.Symbology.Changeable.Changed
member.summary: Occurs when members are added to or removed from this collection. If SuspendChanges is called, this will temporarilly prevent this event from firing, until ResumeEvents has been called.

member.summary: Adds all the features in the specified range. This will throw an exception if the the features are not already in the feature list, since this is simply trying to select those features.

The features being selected.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.FilterCollectionEM.AddRegion(DotSpatial.Symbology.IFeatureSelection,DotSpatial.Topology.IEnvelope)
member.summary: This uses extent checking (rather than full polygon intersection checking). It will add any members that are either contained by or intersect with the specified region depending on the SelectionMode property. The order of operation is the region acting on the feature, so Contains, for instance, would work with points.
member.returns: True if any item was actually added to the collection

The enumerable collection of IFeatures.

member.summary: Tests each member currently in the selected features based on the SelectionMode. If it passes, it will remove the feature from the selection.
member.param: The IFilterCollection that this should be applied to
The geographic region to remove
member.returns: Boolean, true if the collection was changed

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Symbology.GradientModel
member.summary: An enumeration specifying the way that a gradient of color is attributed to the values in the specified range.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.GradientModel.Linear
member.summary: The values are colored in even steps in each of the Red, Green and Blue bands.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.GradientModel.Exponential
member.summary: The even steps between values are used as powers of two, greatly increasing the impact of higher values.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.GradientModel.Logarithmic
member.summary: The log of the values is used, reducing the relative impact of the higher values in the range.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Layer.CanReceiveItem(DotSpatial.Symbology.ILegendItem)
member.summary: Tests the specified legend item. If the item is another layer or a group or a map-frame, then this will return false. Furthermore, if the parent of the item is not also this object, then it will also return false. The idea is that layers can have sub-nodes move around, but not transport from place to place.
member.param: the legend item to test
member.returns: Boolean that if true means that it is ok to insert the specified item into this layer.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.Layer.DataSet
member.summary: Gets or sets the internal data set. This can be null, as in the cases of groups or map-frames. Copying a layer should not create a duplicate of the dataset, but rather it should point to the original dataset. The ShallowCopy attribute is used so even though the DataSet itself may be cloneable, cloning a layer will treat the dataset like a shallow copy.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.IChangeable.ChangesSuspended
member.summary: To suspend events, call SuspendChanges. Then to resume events, call ResumeEvents. If the suspension is greater than 0, then events are suspended.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.ILabelContainer.DrawLabels
member.summary: Draws every label in the layer without worrying about any collision testing or specific tests outside of this label container. If LabelCollisionTesting is set to true, it should still do collision testing for the labels INSIDE this label container.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.ILabelContainer.DrawLabels(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: The list of integers corresponds to the integer values that were returned as keys to the GetLabelExtents dictionary. The Layer will then draw each of the specific lables to draw.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.ILabelContainer.GetLabelExtents
member.summary: Gets the list of non-rotated extents for labels visible in the current display. The integer keys represent the index of the labeled item. The envelope values represent the actual rectangles that the labels occupy for collision testing. If LabelCollisionTesting is true, then collisions should be resolved for the entire layer first based on whatever internal priority methods exist. Only the non-colliding visible labels will be returned.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.ILabelContainer.GetRotatedLabelBounds
member.summary: Gets the list of possibly rotated label boundaries visible in the current display. The integer keys represent the index of the labeled item. The envelope values represent the actual rectangles that the labels occupy for collision testing. If LabelCollisionTesting is true, then collisions should be resolved for the entire layer first based on whatever internal priority methods exist. Only the non-colliding visible labels will be returned.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ILabelContainer.Labels
member.summary: The integer indexed list of all the labels in this container.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ILabelContainer.LabelCollisionTesting
member.summary: If this is set to true, then the only labels being sent to GetLabelExtents should be the labels that actually need to be drawn.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ILabelContainer.Priority
member.summary: A priority rating for all the labels in this layer. The higher this number, the more likely the labels from this layer are to win a collision contest between layers.

member.summary: Characterizes

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.ISymbolRange.IsInRange(System.IComparable)
member.summary: Boolean Tests a value against the minimum and maximum values. If the value is greater than or equal to the MinValue and is less than or equal to the MaxValue then it will be included.
member.param: The IComparable value to test. This is usually a numeric value.
member.returns: True if value is between MinValue and MaxValue

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.ISymbolRange.MatchesClassification(System.IComparable)
member.summary: The classification must implement IComparable. The normal value types like strings, doubles and integers already do this. If the CompareTo method on value returns 0 when compared to the Classification property of this instance, this method will return true. Otherwise, it returns false.
member.param: Any valid implementation of IComparable. This can be either the default value types like integer or string, or else it can be a custom implementation of IComparable.
member.returns: Boolean, true if value.CompareTo returns 0 when compared against this classification.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ISymbolRange.Minimum
member.summary: The minimum value, inclusive, in a range of values. If the value being tested is less than this value, then these properties should not be applied.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ISymbolRange.Maximum
member.summary: Describes the maximum value, inclusive, in a range of values. If the value being tested is greater than this value, then these properties should not be applied.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ISymbolRange.Classification
member.summary: The classification for this symbol. This is the same as specifying the MinValue and MaxValue to be equal and testing the IsInRange property.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.ILabelScheme.AddCategory
member.summary: Adds a category to the scheme, and also names the category with an integer that has not yet been used.
member.returns: A new category with a name that has not yet been used

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.ILabelScheme.Copy
member.summary: returns a duplicate scheme, where the categories are copied, but the underlying featureset is not duplicated.
member.returns: A copy of this label scheme

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.ILabelScheme.Demote(DotSpatial.Symbology.ILabelCategory)
member.summary: Attempts to reduce the integer index representing this categories rank in the list. By doing this, it will be drawn sooner, and therefore subsequent layers will be drawn on top of this layer, and so it reduces the categories priority. If this collection does not contain the category or it is already at index 0, this will return false.
member.param: The ILabelCategory to demote
member.returns: Boolean, true if the demotion was successful

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.ILabelScheme.Promote(DotSpatial.Symbology.ILabelCategory)
member.summary: This attempts to increase the numeric index, which will cause it to be drawn later, or higher up on the cue, which means it will be drawn AFTER the previous layers, and therefore is a higher priority. If the category does not exist in the collection or the category is already at the highest value, this returns false.
member.param: The category to promote if possible.
member.returns: Boolean, true if the promotion was successful

member.summary: Creates a new instance of LabelScheme

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.LabelScheme.AddCategory
member.summary: Adds a category to the scheme, and also names the category with an integer that has not yet been used.
member.returns: A new category with a name that has not yet been used

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.LabelScheme.Clone
member.summary: Returns the Copy, but as an object.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.LabelScheme.Demote(DotSpatial.Symbology.ILabelCategory)
member.summary: Attempts to reduce the integer index representing this categories rank in the list. By doing this, it will be drawn sooner, and therefore subsequent layers will be drawn on top of this layer, and so it reduces the categories priority. If this collection does not contain the category or it is already at index 0, this will return false.
member.param: The ILabelCategory to demote
member.returns: Boolean, true if the demotion was successful

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.LabelScheme.Promote(DotSpatial.Symbology.ILabelCategory)
member.summary: This attempts to increase the numeric index, which will cause it to be drawn later, or higher up on the cue, which means it will be drawn AFTER the previous layers, and therefore is a higher priority. If the category does not exist in the collection or the category is already at the highest value, this returns false.
member.param: The category to promote if possible.
member.returns: Boolean, true if the promotion was successful

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.LabelScheme.Copy
member.summary: The individual categories are copied, meaning that the text symbolizers will be new, and disconnected from the original text symbolizers of this scheme. MemberwiseClone is used so that any subclass members appended to this will be shallow copies unless this method is overridden.
member.returns: A Duplicate LabelScheme, but with new, duplicated categories and symbolizers

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Symbology.LayerFrame
member.summary: This is a class that organizes a list of renderable layers into a single "view" which might be shared by multiple displays. For instance, if you have a map control and a print preview control, you could draw the same data frame property on both, just by passing the graphics object for each. Be sure to handle any scaling or translation that you require through the Transform property of the graphics object as it will ultimately be that scale which is used to back-calculate the appropriate pixel sizes for point-size, line-width and other non-georeferenced characteristics.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.LayerManager.LoadProvidersFromDirectories
member.summary: This should be called once all the permitted directories have been set in the code. This will not affect the PreferredProviders or the general list of Providers. These automatically have the lowest priority and will only be used if nothing else works. Use the PreferredProviders to force preferential loading of a plugin LayerProvider.
member.returns: A list of just the newly added LayerProviders from this method.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.LayerManager.LoadProvidersFromAssembly(System.String)
member.summary: Given a string fileName for the "*.dll" file, this will attempt to load any classes that implement the ILayerProvder interface.
member.param: The string path of the assembly to load from.
member.returns: A list that contains only the providers that were just loaded. This may be a list of count 0, but shouldn't return null.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.LayerManager.DefaultLayerManager
member.summary: Gets or sets the implemenation of ILayerManager for the project to use when accessing data. This is THE place where the LayerManager can be replaced by a different data manager. If you add this data manager to your project, this will automatically set itself as the DefaultLayerManager. However, since each DM will do this, you may have to control this manually if you add more than one LayerManager to the project in order to set the one that will be chosen.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.LayerManager.ActiveProjectLayers
member.summary: Gets or sets a temporary list of active project layers. This is designed to house the layers from a map frame when the property grids are shown for layers in that map frame. This list on the DefaultLayerManager is what is used to create the list that populates dropdowns that can take a Layer as a parameter.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.LayerManager.PreferredProviders
member.summary: Gets or sets a dictionary of ILayerProviders with corresponding extensions. The standard order is to try to load the data using a PreferredProvider. If that fails, then it will check the list of dataProviders, and finally, if that fails, it will check the plugin Layer Providers in directories.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.ILayerProvider.OpenLayer(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{DotSpatial.Symbology.ILayer},DotSpatial.Data.IProgressHandler)
member.summary: This open method is only called if this plugin has been given priority for one of the file extensions supported in the DialogReadFilter property supplied by this control. Failing to provide a DialogReadFilter will result in this plugin being added to the list of DataProviders being supplied under the Add Other Data option in the file menu.
member.param: A string specifying the complete path and extension of the file to open.
A boolean that, if ture, will request that the data be loaded into memory
Any valid IContainer that should have the new layer automatically added to it
An IProgressHandler interface for status messages
member.returns: A List of IDataSets to be added to the Map. These can also be groups of datasets.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ILayerProvider.DialogWriteFilter

member.summary: This provides a basic description of what your provider does.

member.summary: This create new method implies that this provider has the priority for creating a new file. An instance of the dataset should be created and then returned. By this time, the fileName will already be checked to see if it exists, and deleted if the user wants to overwrite it.
member.param: The string fileName for the new instance.
The string short name of the driver for creating the raster.
The number of columns in the raster.
The number of rows in the raster.
The number of bands to create in the raster.
The data type to use for the raster.
The options to be used.
member.returns: A new IRaster.

member.summary: This create new method implies that this provider has the priority for creating a new file. An instance of the dataset should be created and then returned. By this time, the fileName will already be checked to see if it exists, and deleted if the user wants to overwrite it.

Point, Line, Polygon etc. Sometimes this will be specified, sometimes it will be "Unspecified"
Boolean, true if the dataset should attempt to store data entirely in ram
The container for this layer. This can be null.
An IProgressHandler for status messages.

member.summary: Creates an equality type range where both the minimum and maximum are the same value and both are inclusive.

member.summary: A string expression that can be two separate numbers separated by a dash,

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Range.ToString
member.summary: Expresses this range in string form. By default, ranges include the maximum, and exclude the minimum. A null value for one expression will result in a a semi-unbounded range using the greater than or less than symbols. A null expression for both values is completely unbounded and will result in a string that reads like [All Values].
member.returns: A string representing the range.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Range.ToString(DotSpatial.Symbology.IntervalSnapMethod,System.Int32)
member.summary: This is a slightly more complex specification where the numeric formatting controls how the generated string will appear.
member.param: The interval snap method
This is only used for rounding or significant figures, but controls those options
member.returns: A string equivalent of this range, but using a number format.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Range.ToExpression(System.String)
member.summary: Generates a valid SQL query expression for this range, using the field string as the member being compared. The field string should already be bound in brackets, or put together as a normal composit like "[males]/[pop1990]"
member.param: The field name to build into an expression. This should already be wrapped in square brackets.
member.returns: The string SQL query expression.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Range.Contains(System.Double)
member.summary: Tests to determine if this range contains the specified double value.
member.param: the double value to test
member.returns: Boolean, true if the value is within the current bounds.

member.summary: If the minimum and maximum are out of order, this reverses them.

member.summary: If this value is true, whenever a texture is created, the vector layers are drawn onto the texture.

member.summary: Gets or sets the editor settings class to help setup up the symbology controls appropriately.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.IRasterSymbolizer.ElevationFactor
member.summary: This is kept separate from extrusion to reduce confusion. This is a conversion factor that will convert the units of elevation into the same units that the latitude and longitude are stored in. To convert feet to decimal degrees is around a factor of .00000274. This is used only in the 3D-context and does not affect ShadedRelief.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.IRasterSymbolizer.Extrusion
member.summary: A float value expression that modifies the "height" of the apparent shaded relief. A value of 1 should show the mountains at their true elevations, presuming the ElevationFactor is correct. A value of 0 would be totally flat, while 2 would be twice the value. This controls the 3D effects and has nothing to do with the creation of shaded releif on the texture.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.IRasterSymbolizer.HillShade
member.summary: Gets the calculated hillshade map, or re-calculates it if something has changed

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.IRasterSymbolizer.ImageOutline
member.summary: Gets or sets the symbol characteristics for the border of this raster

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.IRasterSymbolizer.IsElevation
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean that determines whether to treat the values as if they are elevation in the 3-D context. If this is true, then it will automatically use this grid for calculating elevation values.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not this raster should render itself

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.IRasterSymbolizer.IsSmoothed
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not htis raster should be anti-alliased

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.IRasterSymbolizer.NoDataColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color to use if the value of the cell corresponds to a No-Data value

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.IRasterSymbolizer.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value from 0 to 1, where 1 is fully opaque while 0 is fully transparent

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.IRasterSymbolizer.Raster
member.summary: Gets or sets the raster that should provide elevation values, but only if "IsElevation" is false.

member.summary: This should be set to true if the elevation values have changed

member.summary: A float value expression that modifies the "height" of the apparent shaded relief. A value of 1 should show the mountains at their true elevations, presuming the ElevationFactor is correct. A value of 0 would be totally flat, while 2 would be twice the value. This controls the 3D effects and has nothing to do with the creation of shaded releif on the texture.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.RasterSymbolizer.HillShade
member.summary: Gets the calculated hillshade map, or re-calculates it if something has changed

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.RasterSymbolizer.ImageOutline
member.summary: Gets or sets the symbol characteristics for the border of this raster

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.RasterSymbolizer.IsElevation
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean that determines whether to treat the values as if they are elevation in the 3-D context. If this is true, then it will automatically use this grid for calculating elevation values. This does not affect ShadedRelief texture creation.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.RasterSymbolizer.IsVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not this raster should render itself

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.RasterSymbolizer.NoDataColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color to use if the value of the cell corresponds to a No-Data value

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.RasterSymbolizer.Raster
member.summary: Gets or sets the raster that should provide elevation values, but only if "IsElevation" is false.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.RasterSymbolizer.ParentLayer
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent layer. This is not always used, but can be useful for symbolic editing that may require a bitmap to be drawn with draped vector layers.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.RasterSymbolizer.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value from 0 to 1, where 1 is fully opaque while 0 is fully transparent

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.RasterSymbolizer.ShadedRelief
member.summary: Gets or sets the characteristics of the shaded relief. This is specifically used to control HillShade characteristics of the BitMap texture creation.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.RasterSymbolizer.IsSmoothed
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not htis raster should be anti-alliased

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.RasterSymbolizer.Scheme
member.summary: Gets or sets the raster coloring scheme.

member.summary: ShadedRelief

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the ShadedRelief preset for elevation in feet and coordinates in decimal degrees

member.summary: Creates a new instance of ShadedRelief based on some more common elevation to goegraphic coordinate sysetem scenarios

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.GetLightDirection
member.summary: Returns a normalized vector in 3 dimensions representing the angle of the light source.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.OnShadingChanged
member.summary: Fires the ShadingChanged event

member.name: E:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.ShadingChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the shading for this object has been altered.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.AmbientIntensity
member.summary: Gets or sets a float specifying how strong the ambient directional light is. This should probably be about 1.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.ElevationFactor
member.summary: This is kept separate from extrusion to reduce confusion. This is a conversion factor that will convert the units of elevation into the same units that the latitude and longitude are stored in. To convert feet to decimal degrees is around a factor of .00000274

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.Extrusion
member.summary: A float value expression that modifies the "height" of the apparent shaded relief. A value of 1 should show the mountains at their true elevations, presuming the ElevationFactor is correct. A value of 0 would be totally flat, while 2 would be twice the value.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.IsUsed
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether the ShadedRelief should be used or not.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.ZenithAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the zenith angle for the light direction in degrees from 0 (at the horizon) to 90 (straight up).

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.LightDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets a double that represents the light direction in degrees clockwise from North

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.LightIntensity
member.summary: This specifies a float that should probably be around 1, which controls the light intensity.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.HasChanged
member.summary: Gets whether or not the values have been changed on this ShadedRelief more recently than a HillShade map has been calculated from it.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Symbology.ScaleMode
member.summary: Specifies whether non-coordinate drawing properties like width or size use pixels or map coordinates. If pixels are used, a "back transform" to approximate pixel sizes.

member.summary: Uses the simplest symbology possible, but can draw quickly

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.ScaleMode.Geographic

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShallowCopy
member.summary: Normally, cloning an object starts with MemberwiseClone, which creates a shallow copy of the object. For any members that derive from the Descriptor, however, any public properties or fields that implement ICloneable are copied (deep copy behavior). This is not always desirable, even if the member CAN be copied. This attribute causes the deep copy behavior to skip over properties marked with this attribute.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Symbology.FeatureLayer
member.summary: This is should not be instantiated because it cannot in itself perform the necessary functions. Instead, most of the specified functionality must be implemented in the more specific classes. This is also why there is no direct constructor for this class. You can use the static "FromFile" or "FromFeatureLayer" to create FeatureLayers from a file.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Symbology.IFeatureLayer

Instead, most of the specified functionality must be implemented in the more specific classes. This is also why there is no direct constructor for this class. You can use the static "FromFile" or "FromFeatureLayer" to create FeatureLayers from a file.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.IFeatureLayer.SnapShot(DotSpatial.Data.Extent,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a bitmap of the requested size that covers the specified geographic extent using the current symbolizer for this layer. This does not have any drawing optimizations, or techniques to speed up performance and should only be used in special cases like draping of vector content onto a texture. It also doesn't worry about selections.

The integer height of the bitmap
member.returns: A Bitmap object

member.summary: This method inverts the selection for the specified region. Members already a part of the selection will be removed from the selection, while members that are not a part of the selection will be added to the selection.
member.param: The region specifying where features should be added or removed from the selection.
With polygon selection it is better not to allow any tolerance since the polygons already contain it.
The SelectionModes enumeration that clarifies how the features should interact with the region.
The geographic region that will be impacted by the changes.
member.returns: The invert selection.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.FeatureLayer.Select(DotSpatial.Topology.IEnvelope,DotSpatial.Topology.IEnvelope,DotSpatial.Symbology.SelectionMode,DotSpatial.Topology.IEnvelope@)
member.summary: Highlights the values in the specified region, and returns the affected area from the selection, which should allow for slightly faster drawing in cases where only a small area is changed. This will also specify the method by which members should be selected.
member.param: The envelope to change.
The envelope to use in cases like polygons where the geometry has no tolerance.
The selection mode that clarifies the rules to use for selection.
The geographic envelope of the region impacted by the selection.
member.returns: Boolean, true if items were selected.

member.summary: Creates a bitmap of the requested size that covers the specified geographic extent using the current symbolizer for this layer. This does not have any drawing optimizations, or techniques to speed up performance and should only be used in special cases like draping of vector content onto a texture. It also doesn't worry about selections.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.FeatureSelection.AddRegion(DotSpatial.Topology.IEnvelope,DotSpatial.Topology.IEnvelope@)
member.summary: This uses extent checking (rather than full polygon intersection checking). It will add any members that are either contained by or intersect with the specified region depending on the SelectionMode property. The order of operation is the region acting on the feature, so Contains, for instance, would work with points.
member.param: The affected area of this addition
member.returns: True if any item was actually added to the collection

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.FeatureSelection.InvertSelection(DotSpatial.Topology.IEnvelope,DotSpatial.Topology.IEnvelope@)
member.summary: Inverts the selection based on the current SelectionMode
member.param: The geographic region to reverse the selected state
The affected area to invert

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.FeatureSelection.Clear
member.summary: This cycles through all the members in the current grouping and re-sets the current category back to the default setting. In other words, if the active type is selection, then this will unselect all the features, but won't adjust any of the other categories.
member.exception: Occurs if this list is set to read-only in the constructor

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.FeatureSelection.Contains(DotSpatial.Data.IFeature)
member.summary: Tests to see if the item is contained in this collection.

member.summary: Copies each of the members of this group to the specified array

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.FeatureSelection.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Gets the enumerator for this collection.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.FeatureSelection.Remove(DotSpatial.Data.IFeature)
member.summary: Removes the specified item from the subset of this classification if that category is used. Selected -> !Selected Category[>0] -> Category[0] Category[0] -> Null Visible -> !Visible Chunk -> -1 or basically a chunk index that is never drawn.
member.param: The item to change the drawing state of
member.returns: Boolean, false if the item does not match the current grouping
member.exception: Occurs if this list is set to read-only in the constructor

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.FeatureSelection.RemoveRegion(DotSpatial.Topology.IEnvelope,DotSpatial.Topology.IEnvelope@)
member.summary: Tests each member currently in the selected features based on the SelectionMode. If it passes, it will remove the feature from the selection.
member.param: The geographic region to remove
A geographic area that was affected by this change.
member.returns: Boolean, true if the collection was changed

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.FeatureSelection.ToFeatureSet
member.summary: As an example, choosing myFeatureLayer.SelectedFeatures.ToFeatureSet creates a new set.
member.returns: An in memory featureset that has not yet been saved to a file in any way.

member.summary: Exports the members of this collection as a list of IFeature.
member.returns: A List of IFeature

member.summary: The new row will be added to the underlying featureset, and this selection will not be updated in any way, as that row is not associated with a featureset here.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.FeatureSelection.AddRow(System.Data.DataRow)
member.summary: The new row will be added to the underlying featureset, and this selection will not be updated in any way, as that row is not associated with a featureset here.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.FeatureSelection.ActiveType
member.summary: Collections can be nested, but for instance if you have gone into category[2].SelectedFeatures and want to remove an item, then we would expect it to show up in Category[2].UnSelectedFeatures, not in Category[0].UnselectedFeatures. So while add necessarilly acts on every filter constraint, remove or clear only operates on the most intimate. The ActiveType records which criteria that is.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to use a texture when drawing these lines. By default, this either checks the DefaultLineProvider or else it is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets a string name to help identify this Symbolizer

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.IFeatureSymbolizerOld.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value from 0 to 1 where 0 is completely transparent and 1 is completely solid. Setting an alpha of a specific feature, like FillColor, to something less than 255 will control that feature's transparency without affecting the others. The final transparency of the feature will be that alpha multiplied by this value and rounded to the nearest byte.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Symbology.IntervalMethod
member.summary: IntervalMethods

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.IntervalMethod.DefinedInterval
member.summary: A numeric value fixes a constant separation between breaks.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.IntervalMethod.EqualInterval
member.summary: The breaks are set to being evenly spaced.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.IntervalMethod.Geometrical
member.summary: Breaks are calculated according to the following restrictions: 1) break sizes follow a geometric progression 2) the number of breaks is specified 3) the sum of squares of the counts per bin is minimized

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.IntervalMethod.Manual
member.summary: Breaks start equally placed, but can be positioned manually instead.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.IntervalMethod.NaturalBreaks
member.summary: Jenks natural breaks looks for "clumping" in the data and attempts to group according to the clumps.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.IntervalMethod.Quantile
member.summary: The breaks are positioned to ensure close to equal quantities in each break.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.IntervalMethod.StandardDeviation
member.summary: Not sure how this works yet. Something to do with standard deviations.

member.summary: Snap the chosen values to the nearest data value.

member.summary: No snapping at all is used

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.IntervalSnapMethod.Rounding
member.summary: Snaps to the nearest integer value.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.IntervalSnapMethod.SignificantFigures
member.summary: Disregards scale, and preserves a fixed number of figures.

The selection symbolizer will be dark cyan bordering light cyan, but use the same dash and cap patterns.

The border color of the line
The width of the entire line
The dash pattern to use
The style of the start and end caps

member.summary: ISymbol

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.ISymbol.CopyPlacement(DotSpatial.Symbology.ISymbol)
member.summary: Only copies the shared placement aspects (Size, Offset, Angle) from the specified symbol.
member.param: The symbol to copy values from.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.ISymbol.GetBoundingSize
member.summary: Takes into account the size, angle, and offset to calculate a rectangular bounding size that completely contains the current symbol.
member.returns: A SizeD representing a size that contains the offset, rotated symbol.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.ISymbol.Draw(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Double)
member.summary: Draws this symbol to the graphics object given the symbolizer that specifies content across the entire set of scales.
member.param: The graphics object should be adjusted so that (0, 0) is the center of the symbol.
If this should draw in pixels, this should be 1. Otherwise, this should be the constant that you multiply against so that drawing using geographic units will draw in pixel units.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.ISymbol.Scale(System.Double)
member.summary: Multiplies all of the linear measurements found in this Symbol by the specified value. This is especially useful for changing units.
member.param: The double precision floating point value to scale by.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.ISymbol.Select
member.summary: Modifies this symbol in a way that is appropriate for indicating a selected symbol. This could mean drawing a cyan outline, or changing the color to cyan.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Symbology.QuickSchemeType
member.summary: QuickSchemeTypes

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.QuickSchemeType.Box
member.summary: Box-plot: Tukey 1977 Basically it is like subdividing the data into 4 quartiles, denoted like Q1, Q2, Q3, Q4. ------- Low Outlier (less than the Quartile - 3/2 Interquartile range) Q1 (Q1 - 3/2 the Interquartile range to Q1 Q2 (Quartile 1 to Median) Q3 (Median to Quartile 3) Q4 (Q3 to Q3 + 3/2 the Interquartile range High Outlier (Greater than Q3 plus the interquartile range

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.QuickSchemeType.DefinedInterval
member.summary: The interval size is defined, rather than the number of subdivisions

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.QuickSchemeType.EqualInterval
member.summary: Symbolize so that the total range of values for a specific field are subdivided into a number of breaks where all the breaks cover the same difference in values.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.QuickSchemeType.Exponential
member.summary: Intervals are selected so that the number of observations in each successive interval increases or decreases exponentially

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.QuickSchemeType.NaturalBreaks
member.summary: The Jenks natural breaks algorithm strives for variance minimization within a classification.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.QuickSchemeType.Percentile
member.summary: Percentile subdivides into the following six categories: less than 1%, 1% to just less than 10%, 10% to just less than 50% 50% to just less than 90% 90% to just less than 99% greater than or equal to 99%

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.QuickSchemeType.Quantile
member.summary: The number of members found in each cateogry is the same, but the range might be widely different for datasets that don't have equally distributed values.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.QuickSchemeType.StandardDeviation
member.summary: The mean and standard deviation of the attribute values are calculated, and values are classified according to their deviation from the mean (z-transform) The transformed values are mapped, usually at intervales of 1.0 or .5 standard deviations. This often results in no central class.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.QuickSchemeType.UniqueValues
member.summary: Symbolize so that each separate entry will have a separate category for that entry.

member.summary: Inverts the selection based on the current SelectionMode

The geographic region to reverse the selected state

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Symbology.SelectionMode
member.summary: SelectionModes

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.SelectionMode.Contains
member.summary: The vertices of the feature are all inside (and not touching the boundary of) the region.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.SelectionMode.ContainsExtent
member.summary: *Faster, the item to be selected must be completely contained by the extent

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.SelectionMode.CoveredBy
member.summary: The entire region is inside the feature and not touching the border.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.SelectionMode.Covers
member.summary: The feature is completely inside the region, but touching the edges is ok (unlike Contains).

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.SelectionMode.Crosses
member.summary: For this to be true the feature must be a point or a curve and must cross the specified

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.SelectionMode.Disjoint
member.summary: The interiors and boundaries don't intersect, touch, or overlap, so they are completely separate.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.SelectionMode.IntersectsExtent
member.summary: *Faster, the item will be selected if any part of that item is visible in the extent

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.SelectionMode.Intersects
member.summary: The most inclusive possible. If any element is touching or overlapping the region in any way, then this will be true.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.SelectionMode.Overlaps
member.summary: Like intersects, specifically requires that part of the feature is inside and part of the feature is outside of the region.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.SelectionMode.Touches
member.summary: The feature has borders or edges in common, but otherwise does not fall inside the region.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.SelectionMode.Within
member.summary: The region is found completely inside the specified region to the extent that no borders come in contact with the outside edge of the region.
